{{BLP sources|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Walter Trout | image = WalterTrout07.jpg | image_size = | caption = Walter Trout at the Riverwalk Blues Festival, 2007 | background = solo_singer | birth_name = | alias = | origin = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1951|03|06|mf=y}} | birth_place = [[Ocean City, New Jersey|Ocean City]], [[New Jersey]], [[United States]] | death_date = | genre = [[Blues]], [[blues rock]] | occupation = [[Musician]]
[[Songwriter]] | Instruments = [[Singing|vocals]], [[guitar]] | years_active = 1969–present | label = Ruf/Platinum/Provogue | associated_acts = [[John Mayall's Bluesbreakers]], [[Canned Heat]], [[Percy Mayfield]] | website = [http://www.waltertrout.com/ Waltertrout.com] | notable_instruments = [[Fender Stratocaster]] }} '''Walter Trout''' (born March 6, 1951, [[Ocean City, New Jersey|Ocean City]], [[New Jersey]], [[United States]]{{cite web |first= |last= |url={{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p132889/biography|pure_url=yes}}|title=Biography by Jason Ankeny |publisher=Allmusic.com|accessdate=December 21, 2009}}) is an [[United States|American]] [[blues]] [[guitarist]], [[singer]] and [[songwriter]]. ==Biography== Trout's career began on the Jersey coast scene of the late 1960s and early 1970s. He then decided to relocate to [[Los Angeles]] where he became a [[sideman]] for [[Percy Mayfield]] and Deacon Jones. He also worked in the [[musical ensemble|bands]] of [[John Lee Hooker]] and [[Joe Tex]]. In 1981 he became the guitarist for [[Canned Heat]]. This led to an invitation to play in [[John Mayall's Bluesbreakers]] where he shared the stage with fellow guitarist [[Coco Montoya]]. He left the Bluesbreakers in 1989 and formed the 'Walter Trout Band' which developed a successful following in Europe. In 1994 the official Walter Trout Fan Club for the [[Netherlands]] and [[Belgium]] was founded, followed in 1996 by the official International Fan Club which has members in 14 countries in Europe, America, Asia and Australia. In 2006 the official International Fan club celebrated its tenth anniversary by giving fan club members an exclusive live [[Compact disc|CD]] recorded in [[Las Vegas, Nevada|Las Vegas]], [[Nevada]], which was the last performance of the late [[bassist]], Jimmy Trapp, who died in 2005. In 1998 Trout released his self-titled [[United States|US]] debut [[album]] and renamed his band 'Walter Trout and the Free Radicals' (later renamed 'Walter Trout and the Radicals' and currently simply 'Walter Trout'). Since that time Trout has been recording and touring in North America, Europe and India. In 2002, he was featured on the [[Bo Diddley]] [[tribute album]], ''Hey Bo Diddley - A Tribute!'', performing the song "[[Road Runner (Bo Diddley song)|Road Runner]]" and many more guest appearances on other [[sound recording and reproduction|recordings]]. In 2014, his album, ''Luther's Blues'', was nominated for a [[Blues Music Award]] in the 'Rock Blues Album of the Year' category.{{cite web|url=http://blues.about.com/od/bluesawards/a/2014-Blues-Music-Awards.htm |title=2014 Blues Music Awards Nominees and Winners |publisher=Blues.about.com |date= |accessdate=2014-05-16}}
